newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine stocks fall 3.78 pct on Brazil fears.
newsitem.headline: Argentine stocks fall 3.78 pct on Brazil fears.

text.p: Argentina's blue-chip Merval stock index was down 3.78 percent at 804.53 in late trading Tuesday with rumors of a Brazilian devaluation unnerving the market, traders said.

"It is clear that there is no problem here in Argentina to explain this fall. The problem is in the whole region starting with Brazil and rumors of a devaluation which would definitely affect us if it happened," a trader told Reuters.
He added, "I don't think there is going to be a devaluation but this an issue which is going to keep hitting us. The Merval corrrection still has further to run."
Volume had totaled $30 million with an hour's trading to go, just above the total volume for all of Monday's session.
In Sao Paulo, the Bovespa stock index was down nearly 9.0 percent.
Economy Minister Roque Fernandez said in Washington Tuesday that he thought a Brazilian devaluation was unlikely.
